result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl Lamont Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carl Lamont Fuller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carl Lamont Fuller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl Lamont Fuller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ORDER TO PRODUCE          RECEIVED AND FILED

Defendant Carl Lamont Fuller in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Carl Lamont Fuller in custody.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for zero days time served. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable court costs and fees by 12/9/18, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Victim Impact Statement.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Carl Lamont Fuller not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not produced from DCI for today's date.  Sentencing set for 12-8-2015.  State to complete OTP.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Carl Lamont Fuller in court with Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Carl Lamont Fuller in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
As to Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED.

As to Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 3 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Carl Lamont Fuller not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 11-2-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Carl Lamont Fuller not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-21-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Teresa W.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carl Lamont Fuller in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  
Defendant Carl Lamont Fuller in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
